pages.text: $(l:https://minecraft.curseforge.com/projects/architect)Architect$() is a mod enabling players to turn their creation into a blueprint and then have it duplicated elsewhere. This enables large builds - with many duplicate features - to be built more quickly.

pages.title: Sketches
pages.text: To get started with Architect, you'll need to $(action)craft$() a $(item)Sketch$() first. $(item)Sketches$() require an $(item)Ender Pearl$(), 5 $(item)Leather$() and 2 $(item)Paper$() to make, or can be recycled from a $(item)Blueprint$().

To add blocks to a sketch, $(action)right-click$() them with the $(item)Sketch$() in your hand. To remove blocks, $(action)right-click them again$().$(br2)If you wish to add all blocks in a rectangular area, $(action)sneak right-click$() one of the corners, then $(action)release the sneak key$() and $(action)right-click$() the corner on the opposite side.$(br2)To remove all blocks in the rectangular area use the same method, but $(action)keep the sneak key held$() while right-clicking the second corner.

pages.title: Block selection
pages.text: Selecting blocks to add to the sketch

Once the sketch is ready, turn it into a blueprint by $(action)pressing and holding right-click$() while not pointing at a block (point to the air). The blueprint can then be used to place the structure - as long as all necessary blocks are available in the player's inventory.$(br2)The blueprint can be rotated by pressing $(k:architect.rotateBlueprint).$(br2)If the blueprint cannot be placed, the blocked locations will be marked red.

pages.title: Item and Fluid Providers
pages.text: Keeping all necessary blocks in your inventory can be difficult for large constructions. To make your life easier, you can craft an $(item)Item Provider$(). By $(action)right-clicking$() the $(item)Item Provider$() on a chest, it will pull items from the chest.

Note that this will work with anything that has an inventory - including, for instance, drawer controllers or machines.$(br2)The $(item)Fluid Provider$() provides a similar function, except that it will draw fluids from a tank in order to fill in liquid blocks.
